availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Payne (Ballard County, Kentucky, common laborer)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, common laborer. Tennessee native. Married to Mary L. Dyre Payne on February 27, 1850. Father of Mary Payne, William J. Payne, David Payne, Mira Payne, Bird Payne, Louisa Payne, Benjamin F. Payne, Lucy Payne, and Elizabeth Payne. Farmer in Van Buren County, Tennessee, in 1850. Common laborer in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Van Buren County, District 5, p. 381. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts, p. 115. Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, microfilm, Van Buren County, 1850, Tennessee State Library and Archives Nashville, TN (accessed via Ancestry).
